reviewText: I've always enjoyed police and rescue TV series, since the days of "Emergency!" and "Third Watch" became my favourite of the genre, not least because it gave you everything - fire, police and paramedics. I've revisited "Emergency!" and still love it, but by comparison, it's squeaky clean, and a product of its time. Third Watch has soap elements, insofar as it spends time on the private lives of the regulars, but there's a method to it. It sheds light on their behaviour on the job. The characters are lifelike, and in most cases flawed, but they are still the ones whose sirens you want to hear if you're in big trouble. They work among real people, the characters of a big city (NY) and, compared with the old "Emergency!" show, it's dirty and often thankless work. I'm eagerly awaiting Season 3. The high point of that season was the very tasteful handling of 9/11 - which happened to be on the "Third Watch" beat. No jets hitting towers, no drum-beating or wringing of hands, just professionals in the field handling their tasks with no time to ponder the larger situation, and wondering why New Yorkers are holding up signs as they pass, calling them heroes.Third Watch: The Complete Second Season
Title: Third Watch: Season 2

reviewText: I hadn't seen the series when it aired on tv. But when the first season came to dvd a friend of mine talked me into giving it a chance and instantly I was hooked. I found it a deep, emotional ,exciting ride. With great characters , wonderful stories and more.The second season has a few less perfect episodes than the first one did. However there are many improvements to make up for it. Many of the stories are even deeper to the point you might be in tears after watching. This show may truly be one of the best shows ever made.If you haven't never seen Third Watch, I suggest the first season to start with as if you don't see it you will miss alot of the refferences in the story to previous events. Once you see that I'm sure you will definantly want to get your hands on the second season.I just wish the 3rd season would come to dvd. If anyone knows if it is please let me know via e-mail at animefreak1983@gmail.com . I'm dieing to see it.Thanks

reviewText: Third Watch: The Complete Second SeasonTotally awesome explains it all!! I've been a Third Watch fan(atic)since the beginning. I brought and looked at the complete first season last year when it was released on dvd. Right after the last episode of season 1 I wanted to jump right in to season 2 but had to wait an entire year for its release on dvd. I just finished season 2 and ready for season 3...unfortunately it looks like i'll have to wait another year! I don't understand why they are releasing them 1 by 1 instead of just releasing all of the seasons so that I will not have wait (impatiently) for the next release.If you are or were ever a fan of Third Watch you will definitely want to purchase this dvd series. Although i've already watched them all, I can watch them all over again because it's SO GOOD!! Also, Amazon's price for this dvd is the cheapest that I've seen so far. Thanks Amazon. :o)

reviewText: I love Third Watch, it was a great show.When Season 1 came out on DVD, I eagerly snatched it up. Funnily enough, I found I actually enjoyed the show more the second time around. The continuity of Season 1 really holds up well under the watchful eye of a keen DVD viewer.However, I am disappointed that the remaining seasons have not been released on Region 4 DVD (as I am in Australia). Whatever the reason, be it copyright issues or something else, I would really like to see the studio get it all sorted out soon. A lot of people are very eager to see the remaining seasons on DVD.Third Watch was one of the greatest 'on the street' emergency services dramas I have ever seen, and I look forward to one day proudly displaying the complete DVD series on my shelf.
summary: When will the Region 4 DVD be released?
Title: Third Watch: Season 2

reviewerName: HE WHO FUNKS BEHIND THE ROWS!!
reviewText: I am a longtime lover of this series, but unlike those who watchedit from the very first episode, I came into it on the second season..in fact the 2-part show "Requiem For A Heavyweight" whereBobby Cannavale's character, Bobby Caffey, is shot and killedby his childhood best friend, played by Kirk Acevedo.That episode should've won an emmy because it is played byall the cast (especially Bobby & Kim) so well and has greatemotional impact!--I actually shed tears when Bobby finallysucuumbs to his chest wound and joins his once estranged fatherin the hereafter as a little child. From that point on untilthe show ended, I never missed an episode!Of course, later on A&E;, I saw the whole show from the firstepisode to the last. Third Watch was one of the last of thewell-written / well-acted tv dramas before tv became bombardedby all that reality show crap!--So glad they finally it brought to DVD.
summary: This Is The Season That Bobby Died!!---Sniffle, Sniffle!!

reviewText: New York cop shows really are not my favorite, but with this one, "Blue", & "C.S.I.NY", I make an exception, but this one I caught by accident one morning on A&E  back in 2008, & was immediately hooked, & I have to say between this one & "NYPD Blue", I don't know which is better, both have similar themes & is about the characters both personal & professional, but this also shows the lives of firefighters, Eddie Cibrian(playing his real life role) is the ex of Kim Raver(24)(who looks better when she is not all glammed up) who have to work side by side somtimes for the NYFD & have a son they share custody with, you also have Doc who has commitment issues, In the NYPD you have Sully, who is a veteran with a younger partner, who is the son of his former partner from way back, then you have Bosco(Jason Wiles) who is a hothead that you just can't help but like especially when he turns around & robs some robbers trying to rob him in one episode, who has a working mom as a partner, all walks of life are here, & this show only gets better with later seasons, Seasons 3, 4, 5, & especially the final Season that has one hell of an opening to it, need to see a release, the first two, out now, did not have that many guest stars, but the later seasons saw veteran stars Roy Schieder as a russian mobster, in 3 & 4, Gerald McRainey(Simon & Simon) as a unstable older cop in "5", rock star Gene Simmons(Kiss) as a mobster responsible for Season 6's explosive opening, the reason for this show's delay I think is the popular music that was on it, why is this always an excuse for a show's delay, but never for a movie??, I really hope the remaining seasons are released, because this is the show's best, Warner Bros. however have made delaying shows an art form, but for now I guess we will all have to wait!, but this is a great companion to "NYPD Blue", which unfortunately is still not completed either!!
summary: This & "NYPD Blue" for some reason just can't get completed...
Title: Third Watch: Season 2

reviewText: Warner. Bros has finally announced the DVD release of Third Watch, the complete second season, on July 7th. Season 2 saw the addition of Amy Carlson as firefighter Alex Taylor, and the the departure of Bobby Cannavale as Bobby Caffey. Also, this season is the beginning of Sully's turbulent relationship with Tatiana. All that I have left to say is IT'S ABOUT TIME!
Title: Third Watch: Season 2

reviewText: I don't catch much TV, so I started watching this series during one of the later seasons. Hubby got me hooked when I sat down to see what he was viewing, so I have some catching up to do. Flawed, and not always admirable, the characters who comprise this show seem so real. I really cared what happened to them. I fell in love with them all immediately, and was devastated when Third Watch went off the air, especially considering the garbage that's followed.  I have seasons 1 and 2 (thank you Amazon!), and have loved getting the back story - but how long will I have to wait until I see those interim episodes? And revisit the last few?  This is one of the finest TV shows ever.  It's a shame that those of us who already love Third Watch and the people who never got a chance to enjoy it are being deprived of one of the last truly excellent TV shows of its kind.
summary: By far, the best TV series EVER!
Title: Third Watch: Season 2

reviewText: Third Watch es -en mi opinión- una serie que no ha sido aún debidamente valorada, por conjugar  acción, emoción y reflexión intensa en cada capítulo.Por su puesto, la acción genera emoción. La construcción de los diálogos y las secuencias que incluyen la participación de diversos personajes (bomberos, policías y paramédicos), despiertan intensas emociones. El ritmo es desbordante, aunque en el correr de los capíulos va dosificándose, para dar tiempo a que la emoción decante.Como el drama está presentado a través de los ojos de esos personajes -no de las víctimas o de los victimarios-, y cada uno de ellos "lee" la realidad desde un ángulo distinto, la reflexión que hace el televidente es el corolario de su identificación con uno o más de ellos. Pero incluso si un espectador se resiste a subir ese peldaño y prefiere quedarse en el de la emoción (o, aún en el primer escalón, el de la acción)igualmente va a sentirse plenamente satisfecho.Para muchos que descubrimos tradíamente Third Watch, lo vemos como una joya que la abuela dejó olvidada en un cofre, pero al encontrarla es imposible no apreciar su valor, desconocido por tanto tiempo.La construcción de la trama y de los personajes es inteligente,
Title: Third Watch: Season 2
